# Example Requirements Document

## Course Enrollment Platform

We need a web platform for course enrollment where students can browse available courses, enroll, and make payments.

### Goals
- Students can browse and search for courses
- Students can enroll in courses online
- Students can pay for courses securely
- Admins can manage the course catalog
- Generate reports for finance team

### Constraints
- Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
- Prefer AWS infrastructure
- Must release MVP in 6 weeks
- Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
- Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

### Features

1. **User Authentication**
   - Student and admin login
   - Password reset functionality
   - Email verification

2. **Course Catalog**
   - List all available courses
   - Course details page (description, instructor, schedule, price)
   - Filter by category, price, schedule

3. **Search Functionality**
   - Search courses by name, instructor, or keywords
   - Auto-complete suggestions

4. **Shopping Cart**
   - Add/remove courses
   - View total price
   - Apply discount codes

5. **Checkout & Payment**
   - Integrate with Stripe for payment processing
   - Support credit card payments
   - Email confirmation after successful payment

6. **Admin Dashboard**
   - CRUD operations for courses
   - Manage instructors
   - View enrollment statistics

7. **Reports**
   - Revenue reports by course
   - Enrollment trends
   - Export to CSV

### Stakeholders
- Students (primary users)
- Course administrators
- Finance team
- System administrators

### Technical Hints
- React for frontend
- Node.js/Express for backend
- PostgreSQL database
- AWS hosting (EC2 + RDS)
- Stripe for payments

requirements.summary: A web platform for course enrollment allowing students to browse, enroll, and make payments for courses, while providing admins capabilities to manage the course catalog and generate finance reports.
goals: Students can browse and search for courses
Students can enroll in courses online
Students can pay for courses securely
Admins can manage the course catalog
constraints: Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

tickets.title: Set up AWS infrastructure
tickets.description: Create and configure the AWS infrastructure to support the web platform, including EC2 instances for the application server and RDS for the PostgreSQL database. This setup will ensure the platform can support up to 1,000 concurrent users and comply with the budget constraint.
acceptanceCriteria: EC2 instance running with appropriate compute capacity
RDS instance running PostgreSQL configured
Infrastructure cost does not exceed $150 per month

tickets.title: Implement user authentication
tickets.description: Develop a user authentication system allowing students and admins to securely log in and access the platform. This system is crucial for personalizing the course browsing and enrollment experience and for securing admin capabilities.
acceptanceCriteria: Given valid credentials, users can log in
Given invalid credentials, users cannot log in
User sessions are securely managed

tickets.title: Build course catalog management for admins
tickets.description: Enable admins to add, update, and remove courses from the catalog. This functionality supports the dynamic nature of course offerings and ensures students have access to the latest courses available.
acceptanceCriteria: Admins can add new courses with details
Admins can update existing course details
Admins can remove courses from the catalog

tickets.title: Implement course browsing and search for students
tickets.description: Allow students to view the list of available courses and use search functionality to find courses of interest. This feature is essential for enhancing the user experience by making course discovery straightforward and efficient.
acceptanceCriteria: Students can view a list of courses
Students can search for courses by keywords
Search results are accurately displayed

tickets.title: Develop shopping cart functionality
tickets.description: Create a shopping cart system where students can add courses they wish to enroll in. This system is a precursor to the checkout and payment process, facilitating a smooth user experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Students can add courses to their shopping cart
Students can view and modify their shopping cart contents
Shopping cart updates are reflected in real-time

tickets.title: Implement secure checkout and payment integration
tickets.description: Integrate a payment system using Stripe to handle course payments securely, ensuring compliance with PCI-DSS standards. This feature allows students to pay for their courses confidently, knowing their financial information is secure.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout process is secure and user-friendly
Payments are processed via Stripe
Compliance with PCI-DSS is ensured

tickets.title: Generate financial reports for the finance team
tickets.description: Develop a reporting tool within the admin dashboard that allows the finance team to generate and export financial reports related to course enrollments and payments. This tool is essential for financial planning and analysis.
acceptanceCriteria: Finance team can generate reports on demand
Reports include detailed financial data on enrollments and payments
Reports can be exported in a common format (e.g., CSV)

tickets.title: Optimize platform for 1,000 concurrent users
tickets.description: Ensure the platform is optimized to handle up to 1,000 concurrent users without performance degradation. This involves stress testing the infrastructure and application, making necessary adjustments to achieve the desired performance.
acceptanceCriteria: Platform can support 1,000 concurrent users
Response times are within acceptable thresholds
No significant performance degradation under load

pros: Breakdown ensures comprehensive coverage of all project goals and features.
Prioritization helps focus development efforts on critical path items first.
Dependencies clearly define the order of implementation, facilitating smooth progress.
cons: Effort estimation complexity may lead to inaccuracies, affecting project timelines.
Interdependent tasks could create bottlenecks if any ticket faces delays.
The fixed scope may limit flexibility in responding to unforeseen challenges or changes in requirements.
alternatives: Agile sprints with more flexible ticket definitions could allow for quicker pivots.
Kanban approach for continuous delivery without fixed iterations might better handle dependencies and bottlenecks.
